Package fr.cnrs.iees.omugi.identity

package fr.cnrs.iees.omugi.identity

Interfaces for managing unique identifiers within a scope.

The core interfaces are Identity, which represents an identifier, and IdentityScope, which returns Identity instances that are guaranteed unique as long as they are constructed by the same instance of IdentityScope. There is absolutely no guarantee for identifiers generated by two different scopes to be unique.

A typical use case is shown on the diagram: GraphFactory uses a IdentityScope internally to construct instances of Elements that have a identifier guaranteed unique among all graph Elements generated by the same GraphFactory instance. This allows to build methods to easily retrieve a node or an edge within a graph based on its identifier.

The Scoped interface is provided for implementation of classes that are attached to a scope.

WARNING: although working perfectly, this class hierarchy has some conceptual flaws; some concepts, like the possibility to ask a scope if a proposed id would fit in its current state, or immutability of identities, are not properly captured in the current hierarchy and will be refactored soon (hopefully).

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 20 ao√ªt 2021
  • Interface Summary
    Interface
    Description
    Identity
    A unique identity within a given scope, to attach to some item that requires a unique identifier - typically, a graph node or edge.
    IdentityScope
    A scope over which Identity instances are guaranteed to be unique.
    Scoped
    An interface for objects that define a scope for identities.
